intro: Silphium angustum, commonly known as narrowleaf silphium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers make it easily identifiable. Silphium angustum is a perennial herb that plays an important role in supporting local biodiversity.
